<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Reveals a target to a [[group]]. If ''toWhom'' is a unit, unit's group is considered. If ''toWhom'' is a vehicle, vehicle commander's group is considered.  The [[knowsAbout|knowledge value]] will be set to the highest level any unit of the revealing side has about the revealed target. If the revealing side has ''no'' knowledge about the revealed target, the value will be set to 1.<br><br>

Since ARMA 2 OA 1.60 the alternative syntax is available. Values greater than or equal 1.5 reveal the side of the target, too. The knowledge level can only be increased, not decreased by this command. Use [[forgetTarget]] first if you need to decrease value.<br><br>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> Informative </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> In multiplayer, [[targetKnowledge]] and [[knowsAbout]] infos get updated only on the PC where command was executed.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> toWhom [[reveal]] target

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> toWhom: [[Object]] or [[Group]]  which receives revealing information

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> target: [[Object]]  which is revealed

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> toWhom [[reveal]] [target, accuracy]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> toWhom: [[Object]] or [[Group]]  which receives revealing information

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> target: [[Object]]  which is revealed

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> accuracy: [[Number]] - knowledge value, clamped to 0..4 range

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[reveal]] _soldierTwo; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>soldierOne [[knowsAbout]] information about soldierTwo is updated</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[reveal]] [[cursorObject]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>player [[knowsAbout]] information about object under cursor is updated</value></part></template></code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[reveal]] [_soldierTwo, 1.5];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[nearTargets]], [[knowsAbout]], [[forgetTarget]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 15, 2007</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">In '''OFP v1.96''', When a target is revealed to a unit, its knowsAbout rating is set to 1, unless it was already more than 1 in which case reveal does nothing. See [[knowsAbout]] for more details about knowsAbout ratings and limitations.</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 24, 2008</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Doolittle|Doolittle]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Use reveal to allow client to ''see'' a [[createVehicle|created vehicle]] faster - the associated menu interaction will become available therefore, like the player has option to get in sooner.
<code>_tank = "M1A1" createVehicle (position player);
player reveal _tank;
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>get in user actions become available instantly</value></part></template></code></dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 15, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">The same idea from Doolittle's note applies to beaming of units. If you [[setPos]] an unit or a player, reveal (all) nearby objects and vehicles to make the interaction possible a lot quicker.</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 15, 2012</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Revealing a targetUnit will also add it to [[nearTargets]] database of the given sourceUnit. The quality/detail level of the info depends on the [[knowsAbout]] value used with reveal. More detail in the [[nearTargets]] page.</dd>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on October 21, 2014 - 15:37 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Units that have been previously subjected to [[enableSimulation]] false; or [[enableSimulationGlobal]] false; may stay unrecognised for a long time even after simulation was re-enabled, returning [[objNull]] as [[cursorTarget]]. Force revealing units with [[reveal]] command usually solves the problem. For example: <code>{[[player]] [[reveal]] _x} [[forEach]] [[allUnits]];</code>
</dd>
</dl>
